title: test_001-Login Flow Test
description: Test user authentication and login flow with valid credentials
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8081", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Try to reload the page to see if the login screen appears or any interactive elements load.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to open a new tab or navigate to a known login URL if available, or report issue if no login access possible.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Login Successful! Welcome Home').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: User authentication and login flow did not succeed as expected. The login screen or home screen confirmation was not found, indicating failure in login or navigation.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: The login page at http://localhost:8081/login is completely empty with no input fields or buttons visible. Unable to perform the user authentication and login flow test with valid credentials due to missing UI elements. The issue has been reported. Task is now complete.

title: test_002-Barcode Scanning Test
description: Test barcode scanning functionality to identify items
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8081", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Try to reload the page to see if the content loads properly.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Item Loaded Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Barcode scanning functionality did not load or display the item correctly as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: The app page at localhost:8081 is empty with no interactive elements visible, preventing any further testing of barcode scanning functionality. Please check the app deployment or frontend server.

title: test_003-Item Verification Test
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8081", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Try to reload the page to see if interactive elements appear
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to open a new tab or navigate to a known login or main page URL to start the test flow
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to open a new tab to check if the main page or another entry point is accessible
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081/main', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to navigate to a known login page or reload the main page again to check for UI elements
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Verification Complete: Quantity Confirmed').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The item quantity verification process did not complete successfully as expected in the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: Test stopped due to empty login page with no interactive elements to proceed with login or item verification. The application frontend does not load the UI as expected, preventing further testing of the item quantity verification process.

title: test_004-Navigation Test
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8081", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down or try to find login form elements to input username and password.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Try to reload the page to see if the login form appears.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Navigation to Mars Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Navigation between different screens did not work as expected, and back button functionality could not be verified.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: The application page at http://localhost:8081/ is completely blank with no visible login form or navigation elements. Multiple reloads and scroll attempts did not reveal any UI components. Unable to proceed with login or navigation testing. Please check the frontend application deployment or environment setup.

title: test_005-Filter and Search Test
description: Test filtering and search functionality on items screen
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8081", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Look for any navigation or login elements to proceed to the items screen or login first.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Try to reload the page or open a new tab to access the login or items screen.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:8081', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=No items found matching your filters').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The test plan to verify filtering and search functionality on the items screen did not pass as expected results were not displayed.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: The frontend page is empty with no interactive elements visible. Unable to proceed with testing filtering and search functionality on items screen. Please check the frontend application setup.
